<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-16"?> <UpdateMetadata xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"> <Metadata> <Commands> <Command> <Id>AnimateActor</Id> <Alias>animate</Alias> <Localizable>false</Localizable> <Summary>Animate properties of the actors with the specified IDs via key frames. Key frames for the animated parameters are delimited with `|` literals.</Summary> <Remarks>Be aware, that this command searches for actors with the provided IDs over all the actor managers, and in case multiple actors with the same ID exist (eg, a character and a text printer), this will affect only the first found one. <br /><br /> When running the animate commands in parallel (`wait` is set to false) the affected actors state can mutate unpredictably. This could cause unexpected results when rolling back or performing other commands that affect state of the actor. Make sure to reset affected properties of the animated actors (position, tint, appearance, etc) after the command finishes or use `@animate CharacterId` (without any args) to stop the animation prematurely.</Remarks> <Examples>; Animate `Kohaku` actor over three animation steps (key frames), ; changing positions: first step will take 1, second — 0.5 and third — 3 seconds. @animate Kohaku posX:50|0|85 time:1|0.5|3
; Start loop animations of `Yuko` and `Kohaku` actors; notice, that you can skip ; key values indicating that the parameter shouldn't change during the animation step. @animate Kohaku,Yuko loop:true appearance:Surprise|Sad|Default|Angry transition:DropFade|Ripple|Pixelate posX:15|85|50 posY:0|-25|-85 scale:1|1.25|1.85 tint:#25f1f8|lightblue|#ffffff|olive easing:EaseInBounce|EaseInQuad time:3|2|1|0.5 wait:false ... ; Stop the animations. @animate Yuko,Kohaku loop:false
; Start a long background animation for `Kohaku`. @animate Kohaku posX:90|0|90 scale:1|2|1 time:10 wait:false ; Do something else while the animation is running. ... ; Here we're going to set a specific position for the character, ; but the animation could still be running in background, so reset it first. @animate Kohaku ; Now it's safe to modify previously animated properties. @char Kohaku pos:50 scale:1</Examples> <Parameters> <Parameter> <Id>ActorIds</Id> <Alias /> <Nameless>true</Nameless> <Required>true</Required> <Localizable>false</Localizable> <ValueContainerType>List</ValueContainerType> <ValueType>String</ValueType> <Summary>IDs of the actors to animate.</Summary> </Parameter> <Parameter> <Id>Loop</Id> <Nameless>false</Nameless> <Required>false</Required> <Localizable>false</Localizable> <ValueContainerType>Single</ValueContainerType> <ValueType>Boolean</ValueType> <DefaultValue>false</DefaultValue> <Summary>Whether to loop the animation; make sure to set `wait` to false when loop is enabled, otherwise script playback will loop indefinitely.</Summary> </Parameter> <Parameter> <Id>Appearance</Id> <Nameless>false</Nameless> <Required>false</Required> <Localizable>false</Localizable> <ValueContainerType>Single</ValueContainerType> <ValueType>String</ValueType> <Summary>Appearances to set for the animated actors.</Summary> </Parameter> <Parameter> <Id>Transition</Id> <Nameless>false</Nameless> <Required>false</Required> <Localizable>false</Localizable> <ValueContainerType>Single</ValueContainerType> <ValueType>String</ValueType> <Summary>Type of the [transition effect](https://naninovel.com/guide/transition-effects.html) to use when animating appearance change (crossfade is used by default).</Summary> </Parameter> <Parameter> <Id>Visibility</Id> <Nameless>false</Nameless> <Required>false</Required> <Localizable>false</Localizable> <ValueContainerType>Single</ValueContainerType> <ValueType>String</ValueType> <Summary>Visibility status to set for the animated actors.</Summary> </Parameter> <Parameter> <Id>ScenePositionX</Id> <Alias>posX</Alias> <Nameless>false</Nameless> <Required>false</Required> <Localizable>false</Localizable> <ValueContainerType>Single</ValueContainerType> <ValueType>String</ValueType> <Summary>Position values over X-axis (in 0 to 100 range, in percents from the left border of the scene) to set for the animated actors.</Summary> </Parameter> <Parameter> <Id>ScenePositionY</Id> <Alias>posY</Alias> <Nameless>false</Nameless> <Required>false</Required> <Localizable>false</Localizable> <ValueContainerType>Single</ValueContainerType> <ValueType>String</ValueType> <Summary>Position values over Y-axis (in 0 to 100 range, in percents from the bottom border of the scene) to set for the animated actors.</Summary> </Parameter> <Parameter> <Id>PositionZ</Id> <Alias>posZ</Alias> <Nameless>false</Nameless> <Required>false</Required> <Localizable>false</Localizable> <ValueContainerType>Single</ValueContainerType> <ValueType>String</ValueType> <Summary>Position values over Z-axis (in world space) to set for the animated actors; while in ortho mode, can only be used for sorting.</Summary> </Parameter> <Parameter> <Id>Rotation</Id> <Nameless>false</Nameless> <Required>false</Required> <Localizable>false</Localizable> <ValueContainerType>Single</ValueContainerType> <ValueType>String</ValueType> <Summary>Rotation values (over Z-axis) to set for the animated actors.</Summary> </Parameter> <Parameter> <Id>Scale</Id> <Nameless>false</Nameless> <Required>false</Required> <Localizable>false</Localizable> <ValueContainerType>Single</ValueContainerType> <ValueType>String</ValueType> <Summary>Scale (`x,y,z` or a single uniform value) to set for the animated actors.</Summary> </Parameter> <Parameter> <Id>TintColor</Id> <Alias>tint</Alias> <Nameless>false</Nameless> <Required>false</Required> <Localizable>false</Localizable> <ValueContainerType>Single</ValueContainerType> <ValueType>String</ValueType> <Summary>Tint colors to set for the animated actors. <br /><br /> Strings that begin with `#` will be parsed as hexadecimal in the following way: `#RGB` (becomes RRGGBB), `#RRGGBB`, `#RGBA` (becomes RRGGBBAA), `#RRGGBBAA`; when alpha is not specified will default to FF. <br /><br /> Strings that do not begin with `#` will be parsed as literal colors, with the following supported: red, cyan, blue, darkblue, lightblue, purple, yellow, lime, fuchsia, white, silver, grey, black, orange, brown, maroon, green, olive, navy, teal, aqua, magenta.</Summary> </Parameter> <Parameter> <Id>EasingTypeName</Id> <Alias>easing</Alias> <Nameless>false</Nameless> <Required>false</Required> <Localizable>false</Localizable> <ValueContainerType>Single</ValueContainerType> <ValueType>String</ValueType> <Summary>Names of the easing functions to use for the animations. <br /><br /> Available options: Linear, SmoothStep, Spring, EaseInQuad, EaseOutQuad, EaseInOutQuad, EaseInCubic, EaseOutCubic, EaseInOutCubic, EaseInQuart, EaseOutQuart, EaseInOutQuart, EaseInQuint, EaseOutQuint, EaseInOutQuint, EaseInSine, EaseOutSine, EaseInOutSine, EaseInExpo, EaseOutExpo, EaseInOutExpo, EaseInCirc, EaseOutCirc, EaseInOutCirc, EaseInBounce, EaseOutBounce, EaseInOutBounce, EaseInBack, EaseOutBack, EaseInOutBack, EaseInElastic, EaseOutElastic, EaseInOutElastic. <br /><br /> When not specified, will use a default easing function set in the actor's manager configuration settings.</Summary> </Parameter> <Parameter> <Id>Duration</Id> <Alias>time</Alias> <Nameless>false</Nameless> <Required>false</Required> <Localizable>false</Localizable> <ValueContainerType>Single</ValueContainerType> <ValueType>String</ValueType> <Summary>Duration of the animations per key, in seconds. When a key value is missing, will use one from a previous key. When not assigned, will use 0.35 seconds duration for all keys.</Summary> </Parameter> <Parameter> <Id>Wait</Id> <Nameless>false</Nameless> <Required>false</Required> <Localizable>false</Localizable> <ValueContainerType>Single</ValueContainerType> <ValueType>Boolean</ValueType> <Summary>Whether the script player should wait for the async command execution before playing next command.</Summary> </Parameter> <Parameter> <Id>ConditionalExpression</Id> <Alias>if</Alias> <Nameless>false</Nameless> <Required>false</Required> <Localizable>false</Localizable> <ValueContainerType>Single</ValueContainerType> <ValueType>String</ValueType> <ValueContext> <Type>Expression</Type> <SubType /> </ValueContext> <NamedValueContext> <Type>Expression</Type> <SubType /> </NamedValueContext> <Summary>A boolean [script expression](https://naninovel.com/guide/script-expressions.html), controlling whether this command should execute.</Summary> </Parameter> </Parameters> </Command> <Command> <Id>AppendText</Id> <Alias>append</Alias> <Localizable>true</Localizable> <Summary>Appends provided text to a text printer.</Summary> <Remarks>The entire text will be appended immediately, without triggering reveal effect or any other side-effects.</Remarks> <Examples>; Print first part of the sentence as usual (gradually revealing the message), ; then append the end of the sentence at once. Lorem ipsum @append " dolor sit amet."</Examples> <Parameters> <Parameter> <Id>Text</Id> <Alias /> <Nameless>true</Nameless> <Required>true</Required> <Localizable>true</Localizable> <ValueContainerType>Single</ValueContainerType> <ValueType>String</ValueType> <Summary>The text to append.</Summary> </Parameter> <Parameter> <Id>PrinterId</Id> <Alias>printer</Alias> <Nameless>false</Nameless> <Required>false</Required> <Localizable>false</Localizable> <ValueContainerType>Single</ValueContainerType> <ValueType>String</ValueType> <ValueContext> <Type>Actor</Type> <SubType>TextPrinters</SubType> </ValueContext> <NamedValueContext> <Type>Actor</Type> <SubType>TextPrinters</SubType> </NamedValueContext> <Summary>ID of the printer actor to use. Will use a a default one when not provided.</Summary> </Parameter> <Parameter> <Id>AuthorId</Id> <Alias>author</Alias> <Nameless>false</Nameless> <Required>false</Required> <Localizable>false</Localizable> <ValueContainerType>Single</ValueContainerType> <ValueType>String</ValueType> <ValueContext> <Type>Actor</Type> <SubType>Characters</SubType> </ValueContext> <NamedValueContext> <Type>Actor</Type> <SubType>Characters</SubType> </NamedValueContext> <Summary>ID of the actor, which should be associated with the appended text.</Summary> </Parameter> <Parameter> <Id>Wait</Id> <Nameless>false</Nameless> <Required>false</Required> <Localizable>false</Localizable> <ValueContainerType>Single</ValueContainerType> <ValueType>Boolean</ValueType> <Summary>Whether the script player should wait for the async command execution before playing next command.</Summary> </Parameter> <Parameter> <Id>ConditionalExpression</Id> <Alias>if</Alias> <Nameless>false</Nameless> <Required>false</Required> <Localizable>false</Localizable> <ValueContainerType>Single</ValueContainerType> <ValueType>String</ValueType> <ValueContext> <Type>Expression</Type> <SubType /> </ValueContext> <NamedValueContext> <Type>Expression</Type> <SubType /> </NamedValueContext> <Summary>A boolean [script expression](https://naninovel.com/guide/script-expressions.html), controlling whether this command should execute.</Summary> </Parameter> </Parameters> </Command> <Command> <Id>ArrangeCharacters</Id> <Alias>arrange</Alias> <Localizable>false</Localizable> <Summary>Arranges specified characters by X-axis. When no parameters provided, will execute an auto-arrange evenly distributing visible characters by X-axis.</Summary> <Examples>; Evenly distribute all the visible characters. @arrange
; Place character with ID `Jenna` 15%, `Felix` 50% and `Mia` 85% away ; from the left border of the scene. @arrange Jenna.15,Felix.50,Mia.85</Examples> <Parameters> <Parameter> <Id>CharacterPositions</Id> <Alias /> <Nameless>true</Nameless> <Required>false</Required> <Localizable>false</Localizable> <ValueContainerType>NamedList</ValueContainerType> <ValueType>Decimal</ValueType> <ValueContext> <Type>Actor</Type> <SubType>Characters</SubType> </ValueContext> <Summary>A collection of character ID to scene X-axis position (relative to the left scene border, in percents) named values. </Command> <Command> <Id>ModifyBackground</Id> <Alias>back</Alias> <Localizable>false</Localizable> <Summary>Modifies a [background actor](https://naninovel.com/guide/backgrounds.html).</Summary> <Remarks>Backgrounds are handled a bit differently from characters to better accommodate traditional VN game flow. Most of the time you'll probably have a single background actor on scene, which will constantly transition to different appearances. To remove the hassle of repeating same actor ID in scripts, it's possible to provide only the background appearance and transition type (optional) as a nameless parameter assuming `MainBackground` actor should be affected. When this is not the case, ID of the background actor can be explicitly provided via the `id` parameter.</Remarks> <Examples>; Set `River` as the appearance of the main background. @back River
; Same as above, but also use a `RadialBlur` transition effect. @back River.RadialBlur
; Position `Smoke` background at the center of the screen ; and scale it 50% of the original size. @back id:Smoke pos:50,50 scale:0.5
; Tint all visible backgrounds on scene. @back id:* tint:#ffdc22</Examples> <Parameters> <Parameter> <Id>AppearanceAndTransition</Id> <Alias /> <Nameless>true</Nameless> <Required>false</Required> <Localizable>false</Localizable> <ValueContainerType>Named</ValueContainerType> <ValueType>String</ValueType> <ValueContext> <Type>Appearance</Type> <SubType /> </ValueContext> <NamedValueContext> <Type>Constant</Type> <SubType>TransitionType</SubType> </NamedValueContext> <Summary>Appearance (or [pose](https://naninovel.com/guide/backgrounds.html#poses)) to set for the modified background and type of a [transition effect](https://naninovel.com/guide/transition-effects.html) to use. When transition is not provided, a cross-fade effect will be used by default.</Summary> </Parameter> <Parameter> <Id>ScenePosition</Id> <Alias>pos</Alias> <Nameless>false</Nameless> <Required>false</Required> <Localizable>false</Localizable> <ValueContainerType>List</ValueContainerType> <ValueType>Decimal</ValueType> <Summary>Position (relative to the scene borders, in percents) to set for the modified actor. Position is described as follows: `0,0` is the bottom left, `50,50` is the center and `100,100` is the top right corner of the scene. Use Z-component (third member, eg `,,10`) to move (sort) by depth while in ortho mode.</Summary> </Parameter> <Parameter> <Id>Id</Id> <Nameless>false</Nameless> <Required>false</Required> <Localizable>false</Localizable> <ValueContainerType>Single</ValueContainerType> <ValueType>String</ValueType> <Summary>ID of the actor to modify; specify `*` to affect all visible actors.</Summary> </Parameter> <Parameter> <Id>Appearance</Id> <Nameless>false</Nameless> <Required>false</Required> <Localizable>false</Localizable> <ValueContainerType>Single</ValueContainerType> <ValueType>String</ValueType> <ValueContext> <Type>Appearance</Type> <SubType /> </ValueContext> <NamedValueContext> <Type>Appearance</Type> <SubType /> </NamedValueContext> <Summary>Appearance to set for the modified actor.</Summary> </Parameter> <Parameter> <Id>Pose</Id> <Nameless>false</Nameless> <Required>false</Required> <Localizable>false</Localizable> <ValueContainerType>Single</ValueContainerType> <ValueType>String</ValueType> <Summary>Pose to set for the modified actor.</Summary> </Parameter> <Parameter> <Id>Transition</Id> <Nameless>false</Nameless> <Required>false</Required> <Localizable>false</Localizable> <ValueContainerType>Single</ValueContainerType> <ValueType>String</ValueType> <ValueContext> <Type>Constant</Type> <SubType>TransitionType</SubType> </ValueContext> <NamedValueContext> <Type>Constant</Type> <SubType>TransitionType</SubType> </NamedValueContext> <Summary>Type of the [transition effect](https://naninovel.com/guide/transition-effects.html) to use (crossfade is used by default).</Summary> </Parameter> <Parameter> <Id>TransitionParams</Id> <Alias>params</Alias> <Nameless>false</Nameless> <Required>false</Required> <Localizable>false</Localizable> <ValueContainerType>List</ValueContainerType> <ValueType>Decimal</ValueType> <Summary>Parameters of the transition effect.</Summary> </Parameter> <Parameter> <Id>DissolveTexturePath</Id> <Alias>dissolve</Alias> <Nameless>false</Nameless> <Required>false</Required> <Localizable>false</Localizable> <ValueContainerType>Single</ValueContainerType> <ValueType>String</ValueType> <Summary>Path to the [custom dissolve](https://naninovel.com/guide/transition-effects.html#custom-transition-effects) texture (path should be relative to a `Resources` folder). Has effect only when the transition is set to `Custom` mode.</Summary> </Parameter> <Parameter> <Id>Visible</Id> <Nameless>false</Nameless> <Required>false</Required> <Localizable>false</Localizable> <ValueContainerType>Single</ValueContainerType> <ValueType>Boolean</ValueType> <Summary>Visibility status to set for the modified actor.</Summary> </Parameter> <Parameter> <Id>Position</Id> <Nameless>false</Nameless> <Required>false</Required> <Localizable>false</Localizable> <ValueContainerType>List</ValueContainerType> <ValueType>Decimal</ValueType> <Summary>Position (in world space) to set for the modified actor. Use Z-component (third member) to move (sort) by depth while in ortho mode.</Summary> </Parameter> <Parameter> <Id>Rotation</Id> <Nameless>false</Nameless> <Required>false</Required> music)](https://naninovel.com/guide/audio.html#background-music) track with the provided name.</Summary> <Remarks>Music tracks are looped by default. When music track name (BgmPath) is not specified, will affect all the currently played tracks. When invoked for a track that is already playing, the playback won't be affected (track won't start playing from the start), but the specified parameters (volume and whether the track is looped) will be applied.</Remarks> <Examples>; Starts playing a music track with the name `Sanctuary` in a loop. @bgm Sanctuary
; Same as above, but fades-in the volume over 10 seconds and plays only once. @bgm Sanctuary fade:10 loop:false
; Changes volume of all the played music tracks to 50% over 2.5 seconds ; and makes them play in a loop. @bgm volume:0.5 loop:true time:2.5
; Plays `BattleThemeIntro` once and then immediately `BattleThemeMain` in a loop. @bgm BattleThemeMain intro:BattleThemeIntro</Examples> <Parameters> <Parameter> <Id>BgmPath</Id> <Alias /> <Nameless>true</Nameless> <Required>false</Required> <Localizable>false</Localizable> <ValueContainerType>Single</ValueContainerType> <ValueType>String</ValueType> <ValueContext> <Type>Resource</Type> <SubType>Audio</SubType> </ValueContext> <NamedValueContext> <Type>Resource</Type> <SubType>Audio</SubType> </NamedValueContext> <Summary>Path to the music track to play.</Summary> </Parameter> <Remarks>Consider using `<br>` tag instead with [TMPro printers](https://naninovel.com/guide/text-printers.html#textmesh-pro).</Remarks> <Examples>; Second sentence will be printed on a new line. ; Second sentence will be printer two lines under the first one. (subroutine) in a programming language, allowing to reuse a piece of naninovel script. It's possible to declare a gosub outside of the currently played script and use it from any other scripts, which could be useful for invoking a repeating set of commands multiple times.</Remarks> <Examples>; Navigate the playback to the label `VictoryScene` in the currently played script, ; executes the commands and navigates back to the command after the `gosub`. @gosub .VictoryScene ... @stop # VictoryScene @back Victory @sfx Fireworks @bgm Fanfares You are victorious! @return

; Navigates the playback to the label `Epilogue` in the currently played script. @goto .Epilogue ... # Epilogue ...</Examples> <Parameters> <Parameter> <Id>Path</Id> <Alias /> <Nameless>true</Nameless> <Required>true</Required> <Localizable>false</Localizable> <ValueContainerType>Named</ValueContainerType> <ValueType>String</ValueType> <ValueContext> <Type>Resource</Type> <SubType>Scripts</SubType> </ValueContext> <Summary>Path to navigate into in the following format: `ScriptName.LabelName`. whether this command should execute.</Summary> </Parameter> </Parameters> </Command> <Command> <Id>SetCustomVariable</Id> <Alias>set</Alias> <Localizable>false</Localizable> <Summary>Assigns result of a [script expression](https://naninovel.com/guide/script-expressions.html) to a [custom variable](https://naninovel.com/guide/custom-variables.html).</Summary> <Remarks>If a variable with the provided name doesn't exist, it will be automatically created. <br /><br /> It's possible to define multiple set expressions in one line by separating them with `;`. The expressions will be executed in sequence by the order of declaration. <br /><br /> In case variable name starts with `T_` or `t_` it's considered a reference to a value stored in 'Script' [managed text](https://naninovel.com/guide/managed-text.html) document. Such variables can't be assigned and mostly used for referencing localizable text values.</Remarks> <Examples>; Assign `foo` variable a `bar` string value. @set foo="bar"
; Assign `foo` variable a 1 number value. @set foo=1
; Assign `foo` variable a `true` boolean value. @set foo=true
; If `foo` is a number, add 0.5 to its value. @set foo+=0.5
; If `angle` is a number, assign its cosine to `foo` variable. @set foo=Cos(angle)
; Get a random integer between -100 and 100, then raise to power of 4 and assign to ; `foo` variable. Quotes required when whitespace is present inside the expression. @set "foo = Pow(Random(-100, 100), 4)"
; If `foo` is a number, add 1 to its value (increment). @set foo++
; If `foo` is a number, subtract 1 from its value (decrement). @set foo--
; Assign `foo` variable value of the `bar` variable, which is `Hello World!` string. @set bar="Hello World!" @set foo=bar
; Defining multiple set expressions in one line (the result will be the same as above). @set bar="Hello World!";foo=bar
; It's possible to inject variables to naninovel script command parameters. @set scale=0 # EnlargeLoop @char Kohaku.Default scale:{scale} @set scale+=0.1 @goto .EnlargeLoop if:scale<1
; ...and generic text lines. @set name="Dr. Stein";drink="Dr. Pepper" {name}: My favourite drink is {drink}!
; When using double quotes inside the expression itself, ; don't forget to double-escape them. @set remark="Shouting \\"Stop the car!\\" was a mistake."
; Use global variable to indicate player reaching `Ending 001`. ; The variable will remain true even when the game is restarted. @set g_Ending001Reached=true
; Increment the global variable only once, even when re-played. @set g_GlobalCounter++ if:!HasPlayed()</Examples> <Parameters> <Parameter> <Id>Expression</Id> <Alias /> <Nameless>true</Nameless> <Required>true</Required> <Localizable>false</Localizable> <ValueContainerType>Single</ValueContainerType> <ValueType>String</ValueType> <ValueContext> <Type>Expression</Type> <SubType /> </ValueContext> <NamedValueContext> <Type>Expression</Type> <SubType /> </NamedValueContext> <Summary>Set expression. <br /><br /> The expression should be in the following format: `VariableName=ExpressionBody`, where `VariableName` is the name of the custom variable to assign and `ExpressionBody` is a [script expression](https://naninovel.com/guide/script-expressions.html), the result of which should be assigned to the variable. <br /><br /> It's also possible to use increment and decrement unary operators (`@set foo++`, `@set foo--`) and compound assignment (`@set foo+=10`, `@set foo-=3`, `@set foo*=0.1`, `@set foo/=2`).</Summary> </Parameter> <Parameter> <Id>Wait</Id> <Nameless>false</Nameless> <Required>false</Required> <Localizable>false</Localizable> When invoked for a track that is already playing, the playback won't be affected (track won't start playing from the start), but the specified parameters (volume and whether the track is looped) will be applied.</Remarks> <Examples>; Plays an SFX with the name `Explosion` once. @sfx Explosion
; Plays an SFX with the name `Rain` in a loop and fades-in over 30 seconds. @sfx Rain loop:true fade:30
; Changes volume of all the played SFX tracks to 75% over 2.5 seconds ; and disables looping for all of them. @sfx volume:0.75 loop:false time:2.5</Examples> <Parameters> <Parameter> <Id>SfxPath</Id> <Alias /> <Nameless>true</Nameless> <Required>false</Required> <Localizable>false</Localizable> <ValueContainerType>Single</ValueContainerType> <ValueType>String</ValueType> <ValueContext> <Type>Resource</Type> <SubType>Audio</SubType> </ValueContext> <NamedValueContext> <Type>Resource</Type> <SubType>Audio</SubType> </NamedValueContext> <Summary>Path to the sound effect asset to play.</Summary> </Parameter> <Parameter> <Id>Volume</Id> <Nameless>false</Nameless> <Required>false</Required> <Localizable>false</Localizable> <ValueContainerType>Single</ValueContainerType> <ValueType>Decimal</ValueType> <DefaultValue>1</DefaultValue> <Summary>Volume of the sound effect.</Summary> </Parameter> <Parameter> <Id>Loop</Id> <Nameless>false</Nameless> <Required>false</Required> <Localizable>false</Localizable> <ValueContainerType>Single</ValueContainerType> <ValueType>Boolean</ValueType> <DefaultValue>false</DefaultValue> <Summary>Whether to play the sound effect in a loop.</Summary> </Parameter> <Parameter> <Id>FadeInDuration</Id> <Alias>fade</Alias> <Nameless>false</Nameless> <Required>false</Required> <Localizable>false</Localizable> <ValueContainerType>Single</ValueContainerType> <ValueType>Decimal</ValueType> <DefaultValue>0</DefaultValue> <Summary>Duration of the volume fade-in when starting playback, in seconds (0.0 by default); Unlike [@sfx](https://naninovel.com/api/#sfx) command, the clip is played with minimum delay and is not serialized with the game state (won't be played after loading a game, even if it was played when saved).
